lead_paragraph: A steady flow of newcomers has created satellite Chinatowns in neighborhoods pushing southeast toward the ocean, areas that traditionally have been enclaves for Europeans and Russians.

headline.print_headline: With an Influx of Newcomers, Little Chinatowns Dot a Changing Brooklyn
headline.main: With an Influx of Newcomers, Little Chinatowns Dot a Changing Brooklyn

snippet: A steady flow of newcomers has created satellite Chinatowns in neighborhoods pushing southeast toward the ocean, areas that traditionally have been enclaves for Europeans and Russians.
abstract: Steady influx of Chinese immigrants has created series of satellite Chinatowns outside traditional Brooklyn enclaves of Sunset Park and Bensonhurst; groups are pushing southeast toward ocean, creating communities in neighborhoods that have long been home to Europeans and Russians; growth reflects fact that Chinese are soon expected to overake Dominicans as most populous foreign-born group in New York City.
